sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Dust Extraction Unit for removal of airborne dust particles during pharmaceutical manufacturing operations to maintain clean and safe working environment.
sections.scope: Applicable to dust extraction activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the dust extraction unit is properly installed near the dust-generating equipment.
Verify that all ductwork connections are secure and properly sealed.
Check that the collection bags or filters are clean and properly installed.
Inspect the exhaust ducting for any blockages or damage.
Verify that the electrical connections are secure and properly grounded.
Ensure all access panels and inspection doors are closed and secured.
Power ON the dust extraction unit before starting the production equipment.
Check the airflow by observing pressure gauge or indicator.
Adjust dampers or airflow controls if required to achieve proper suction.
Verify that dust is being effectively captured at the source.
Monitor the pressure differential across filters during operation.
Check collection bags or containers periodically for dust accumulation.
If pressure drop increases significantly, clean or replace filters.
Ensure continuous operation during all dust-generating activities.
After production completion, continue running for few minutes to clear residual dust.
Power OFF the dust extraction unit after ensuring all dust is cleared.
Open access panels and inspect filters and collection containers.
Empty collection containers and dispose of collected dust as per waste protocols.
Clean or replace filters as per maintenance schedule.
Check for any leaks or damage in the ductwork and seals.
Document operation hours, filter changes, and maintenance activities in the logbook.
precautions: Always start dust extraction before beginning dust-generating operations.
Never operate dust-generating equipment without active dust extraction.
Monitor filter condition regularly to maintain extraction efficiency.
Replace filters when pressure drop exceeds specified limits.
Ensure proper disposal of collected dust as per safety guidelines.
Check for combustible dust hazards and use appropriate explosion-proof units if needed.
Maintain proper grounding to prevent static electricity buildup.
Inspect and clean ductwork periodically to prevent blockages.
Wear appropriate PPE including mask and gloves during filter changes.
Follow lockout/tagout procedures during maintenance activities.
